lead_paragraph: Cleveland center LeCharles Bentley, a two-time Pro Bowler, was cleared to return to the playing field, another major step in his comeback from a knee injury. He was cleared by Dr. Russell Warren, the Giants’ team physician, who performed two operations on Bentley.Bentley tore the patellar tendon in his left knee on the first play of training camp last season with the Browns. The injury was complicated by a staph infection, which Bentley said became so severe that it nearly killed him; doctors considered amputation.Bentley said he planned to be back in Cleveland on Thursday to report for training camp.
